article_title: Firefighters rush to 18-wheeler fire near downtown Dallas
article_text:
Fire crews rushed to an 18-wheeler fire on Interstate 35 near downtown Dallas around 11 a.m Sunday.

The vehicle fire occurred where Interstate 35 East crosses over Interstate 30, near the exit for Reunion Boulevard and Commerce Street. Police advised drivers to avoid the area.

Dallas County Sheriff’s Office spokesperson Raul Reyna said the driver was not injured. He said police and fire crews do not know what may have caused the fire. They are trying to determine if the 18-wheeler hit something.

Texas Department of Transportation and a hazardous materials crew responded to clean up a fuel spill, Reyna said.

Watch video of firefighters at the scene:

(Video by Nancy Visser of The Dallas Morning News)

Fire crews rushed to an 18-wheeler fire on Interstate 35 near downtown Dallas around 11 a.m Sunday.
The vehicle fire occurred where Interstate 35 East crosses over Interstate 30, near the exit for Reunion Boulevard and Commerce Street.

Dallas County Sheriff’s Office spokesperson Raul Reyna said the driver was not injured.
Texas Department of Transportation and a hazardous materials crew responded to clean up a fuel spill, Reyna said.
